meanings.definition: To edit or prepare (written material) for publication or presentation, usually with another person.
meanings.sent1: She and her friend coedited the school newspaper.
meanings.sent2: The authors coedited the research paper before submitting it.
meanings.sent3: The two siblings coedited their birthday party invitation to make it perfect.
meanings.sent4: The team coedited the project proposal to ensure it was flawless.
meanings.sent5: The students coedited the class presentation to make it more engaging.

meanings.definition: To work jointly with others in editing or preparing written material for publication or presentation.
meanings.sent1: The group coedited the magazine article to meet the deadline.
meanings.sent2: They coedited the script for the play to enhance its impact.
meanings.sent3: The friends coedited the recipe book, adding funny comments along the way.
meanings.sent4: The committee coedited the report, combining their expertise for accuracy.
meanings.sent5: The team coedited the manual, ensuring clarity for all readers.
